The logical fallacy used in the text is the ad hominem attack. Ad hominem is a type of fallacy in which an argument is rejected on the basis of some characteristic or belief of the person proposing the argument, rather than on the basis of the argument itself. In this case, the text is attacking the credibility of the author by questioning their trustworthiness due to the bankruptcy of the company they work for. This is an example of an ad hominem attack, as the focus is on the author's character or the company they work for, rather than addressing the argument itself.</s>

Now, we can calculate the depths of points A and C:

Point A:
Depth = √((x2 - x1)^2 + (y2 - y1)^2 + (z2 - z1)^2)
= √((0.36 - 0.0)^2 + (0.74 - 0.0)^2 + (0.88 - 0.88)^2)
= √((0.36 - 0.0)^2 + (0.74 - 0.0)^2)
= √(0.36^2 + 0.74^2)
= √(12.064 + 5.552)
= √17.616
= 15.6

= √((0.73 - 0.0)^2 + (0.74 - 0.0)^2)
= √(0.73^2 + 0.74^2)
= √(5.196 + 0.74^2)
= √(5.196 + 5.552)
= √10.748
= 16.2

So, the depths of points A and C are 15.6 and 16.2, respectively.</s>
